name: 1.0 - Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings.
– all drawings are the latest revision.
Record of conformity - Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls being implemented, that is PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Work area has been cleared and surveyed (marked on site). Limits of excavation clearly defined.
○ Pits & trenches all marked out prior to excavation commencing
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
– Ensure uPVC conduits comply with AS 1477 or equivalent AS 2053
– Shall be heavy duty, orange for electrical services and white for communication services
– Ensure pipe diameter is correct AS per drawings
– uPVC Non Pressure Pipes shall be DWV MIN SN8 Solvent Welded to AS 1462 with an environmental product
– uPVC pipe Shall be SN10 SWJ AS per DCWC Mgt-RTRFI-1317
– Polyethylene pipe shall be used conforming to AS 4130 & 4131
Record of conformity - Aconex Reference, This Signed ITP, Building Engineering ITC
– Ensure that the conduit bedding material is non- plastic granitic sand complying with Table 3-1 and 3-2 under cl. 3.8.3.3 of the Works Specification
– Ensure Bedding Material is Well Graded
– Manufactured Sand to VicRoads Specification 407 Clause 407.03(f).
Record of conformity - Aconex Reference, This Signed ITP, Building Engineering ITC
– Spel Puraceptor for approval prior to commencing works.
– Septic Tank & Sewer Disposal Unit Design
– Pre-cast Pits for approval prior to commencing works
Record of conformity - Aconex Reference, Building Engineering ITC
– Location of services to be found and marked on the ground within the works;
– Contractor to obtain excavation permit from APAM prior to any demolition works.
– Services located within the works area to be exposed/proven, recorded as survey data and also on a service plan which is to be attached to the Excavation Permit.

○ Service conduits shall be protected from damage due to subsequent construction operations as required using whatever measures are necessary. Any damaged conduits shall be removed and replaced at no cost to the Principal.
Record of conformity - Melbourne Airport Excavation Permit, PIC
Acceptance Criteria - Native grass protection installed. As per native grass model
Reference Documents - Relevant Native Grass Permit
Record of conformity - FH-ZU2-QU-ITP038, This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Trenches for pipes shall be excavated to the width and depth required enabling construction of the pipes to the requirements specified on the drawings.
– Inconsistent, rocky or soft material at base of trench shall be excavated and replaced with compacted select fill
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Only approved methods of excavation that has been approved by the Principal’s Representative shall be used.
– Location, level and configuration of existing service crossing to be recorded in as built documentation prior to backfill (including CAD model file)
Reference Documents - WMS002 – Working Near Existing Services
Record of conformity - As-built survey report
Acceptance Criteria - Pits, pipes & structures shall be constructed to the line, levels and dimensions shown on the drawings
– Pipes shall be bedded evenly on sand compacted to min 100mm thickness below the socket
– Pipe laying Shall be constructed at the downstream end of the pipe run. all Pipes Shall be laid with sockets pointing upstream
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Frequency - Prior to backfilling each lot
○ Backfilling of the trenches shall not proceed until the pipeline has been tested and inspected.
○ Check for leaks to the requirement of clause 15.2 of AS3500.2
– Inspect for proper laying and jointing
– Expansion/swivel joints provided for all pipework
– Testing as per AS 3500.3 to be carried out
– Building Engineering to run camera through Stormwater pipeas and upload link
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection, Test Result
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Trenches for pipes shall be excavated to the width and depth required enabling construction of the pipes to the requirements specified on the drawings.
– Inconsistent, rocky or soft material at base of trench shall be excavated and replaced with compacted select fill
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Only approved methods of excavation that has been approved by the Principal’s Representative shall be used.
○ Location, level and configuration of existing service crossing to be recorded in as built documentation prior to backfill (including CAD model file)
Reference Documents - WMS002 – Working Near Existing Services
Record of conformity - As-built survey report, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Pits, pipes & structures shall be constructed to the line, levels and dimensions shown on the drawings
– Pipes shall be bedded evenly on sand compacted to min 100mm thickness below the socket
– Pipe laying Shall be constructed at the downstream end of the pipe run. all Pipes Shall be laid with sockets pointing upstream
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Frequency - Prior to backfilling each lot
– Pipeline will need to be tested and inspected prior to any backfilling
– Inspect for proper laying and jointing
– Expansion/swivel joints provided for all pipework
– Use temporary capping to isolate piping to be tested; fill piping with clean water and check for leaks to the requirement of clause 15.2 of AS 3500.2
– After testing, drain and reconnect the piping, flush the drains clean with water and check for fall to discharge
– Building Engineering to run camera through Sanitary pipes and upload link
Reference Documents - Building Engineering ITC, ZULU-BECA-001-SPC-00005 C1700.8 .2 C AS 3500.2
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection, Test Result
Record of conformity - This ITP signed Camera Footage, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Trenches for pipes shall be excavated to the width and depth required enabling construction of the pipes to the requirements specified on the drawings.
– Inconsistent, rocky or soft material at base of trench shall be excavated and replaced with compacted select fill
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Only approved methods of excavation that has been approved by the Principal’s Representative shall be used.
– Location, level and configuration of existing service crossing to be recorded in as built documentation prior to backfill (including CAD model file)
Reference Documents - WMS002 – Working Near Existing Services
Record of conformity - As-built survey report, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Pits, pipes & structures shall be constructed to the line, levels and dimensions shown on the drawings
– Pipes shall be bedded evenly on sand compacted to min 100mm thickness below the socket
– Pipe laying Shall be constructed at the downstream end of the pipe run. all Pipes Shall be laid with sockets pointing upstream
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Frequency - Prior to backfilling each lot
○ Pipeline will need to be tested and inspected prior to any backfilling
○ Inspect for proper laying and jointing
○ Conduct Pressure Test and Flushing of the Pipeline
– Prior to testing, flush all pipework and equipment with clean potable water until the flushed water runs out completely clear
– Pressurise with clean potable water (free of oil and other impurities) and maintain the test pressure for 2 hrs
– Immediately after successful testing, final flush all pipework and equipment with clean potable water at “full flow” for at least 10 minutes
○ In addition to general flushing and cleaning requirement above, disinfect and passivate pipework systems in accordance with AS 3500.1 and any relevant manufacturer written instructions
Reference Documents - Drawings ZULU-BECA-001-SPC-00005 C1700.8 .2 a AS 3500.1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Trenches for conduits shall be excavated to the width and depth required enabling construction of the conduits to the requirements specified on the drawings.
– The level at the bottom of the trench shall not be above the required level at any point.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Only approved methods of excavation that has been approved by the Principal’s Representative shall be used.
– Location, level and configuration of existing service crossing to be recorded in as built documentation prior to backfill (including CAD model file)
Reference Documents - WMS002 – Working Near Existing Services
Record of conformity - As-built survey report, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - All conduits shall be rigidly supported and positioned by concrete former or plastic spacer blocks so that no displacement occurs during backfill.
– Where conduit ends are not open to a pit, UPVC end caps shall be temporarily fitted to each end.
– Number of conduits and duct route to be confirmed for conformity with design.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Frequency - Prior to backfilling each lot
○ All trenches shall be inspected by the Contract Administrator before backfilling takes place.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Pavement edge duct markers shall be installed at the edge of pavements immediately over the centreline of duct banks.
– Warning tape shall be to AS 2648.1, and coloured orange for electrical/white for communications conduits.
Reference Documents - ZULU-BECA-001-SPC-00004 cl. 3.11, cl. 3.12 AS 2648.1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC

Acceptance Criteria - - Following installation, the conduit shall be checked by passing a mandrel (not less than 300mm long and having a diameter of not more than 6mm less than the diameter of the conduit) through each way, followed by a brush with stiff bristles to clean the conduit of any foreign materials.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC

Acceptance Criteria - Each duct way in each duct bank shall be fitted with a single unjointed length of draw cord of a length equal to the length of the duct plus 4m. The draw cord shall be nylon rope and be 6mm in diameter, blue in colour. The ends of the rope shall be coiled at the bottom of each pit or wound around a stake.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Building Engineering ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Surveyor to pick up completed pipe/conduit runs & underground tanks before backfill
– Bedding material shall encase the pipe to 100mm compacted thickness above the pipe and be compacted simultaneously around both sides of the pipe
– Backfill remaining area with site won material from excavations and compact in minimum 200mm thick layers
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering ITC

Acceptance Criteria - The minimum frequency of field density tests shall be in accordance with AS3798 table 8.1 and not less than 1 test per 50m of compacted backfill in each layer of pipe trench fill.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed Test Results
– Final backfilling in existing pavement areas shall to 100% compaction
– Basecourse depth shall be 400mm or existing pavement depth, whichever is greater
– The final 100mm of backfilling shall be clean topsoil
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed, Building Engineering ITC
7.0 - Construction – Precast Pits, Headwalls, & Underground Tanks
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure placement of tanks is as per manufacturer specification and as per design levels
Reference Documents - Drawings, Manufacturer’ s Specification
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Pits placed and levelled as per survey set out
Record of conformity - This ITP signed.
○ Each pit/headwall shall be bedded and be backfilled with stabilised sand for grassed areas.
○ Principals Representative shall be notified to inspect installed pits with all connections prior to backfilling
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Pits shall be labelled and directional markers placed. Lids to be secured and area cleaned/demolished
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
